categories: Hair, Hair Styling & Treatments, Dry Shampoo
about: What it is:...Hair Type:...Hair Texture:...Hair Concerns:.....Key Benefits:.....Highlighted Ingredients:.....Ingredient Callouts:...What Else You Need to Know:..*Based on an internal study: One Fairy Duster sprayed as many uses as approximately four aerosol dry shampoo bottles containing 4.5oz...Fragrance Description:...
ingredients: -Mojave Yucca: Promotes a balanced scalp by naturally cleansing and exfoliating. .-Prickly Pear Seed Oil: Nourishes and softens hair. .-Cactus Flower Extract: Strengthens and improves manageability. ..Zea Mays (Corn) Starch, Maranta Arundinacea Root Extract, Water/Aqua, Bentonite, Silica, Dimethicone, Fragrance, Limonene, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis (Orange) Peel Oil, Quartz, Glycerin, Linalool, Opuntia Ficus-Indica Seed Oil, Opuntia Ficus-Indica Flower Extract, Yucca Schidigera Stem Extract, Moringa Oleifera Leaf Extract, Benzyl Salicylate, Geraniol, Citronellol, Citral...The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Pull off cap..-Section hair..-Hold four to six inches away from roots..-Start with one gentle pump, and add more as needed..-Let sit 15 to 30 seconds for powder to absorb oil.-Massage in with fingertips or blending brush..-This powder formula is concentrated, so ‚Äúpoof‚Äù a little at a time to avoid the dreaded white cast!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I bought this after I tried a few aerosol dry shampoo sprays that did almost nothing for my oily hair. I have very fine, stick straight hair that gets greasy looking sometimes as soon as 12 hours after I wash it. The only dry shampoo I‚Äôve tried that worked well was a similar powder product, but it came in a bottle that made application difficult and messy. I was excited to give this product a try because it was similar in formula/ingredients to the powder that worked for me a while ago, but with an easier to use spray nozzle. When I first tried to apply it, I was not expecting so much product to come out so quickly - so definitely use caution for the first use, and make sure you‚Äôre not wearing dark clothes that could get the powder on them! After getting the hang of it, though, I can apply it without any mess. It is super easy to blend out even if there‚Äôs a lot in one spot (however I do have dark blonde hair, not sure how it looks on darker brown or black hair), and it even gives a bit of texture and volume which is exactly what my fine, straight hair needs! The fresh, fruity scent is heavenly to me. However, if you don‚Äôt enjoy scented products, you may not like that part of it. My hair looks nice and clean for much longer between washes compared to other aerosol dry shampoos or not using any product. Overall I think this product is perfect for ME and anyone else with lighter hair looking for a product to help extend time between washes and add a bit of texture and volume.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: First, I'll say that I'm obsessed and I'll never go back to aerosol dry shampoo. The pump works flawlessly and the powder rubs in so incredibly easily. This is perfect for day 2+ hair - even for an oily girl. Beware that it does have a scent - which personally I love - but for those that are sensitive to fragrance, you may not like it. To me, it's a fruity type smell.   That being said, I think it's too expensive. I found a great alternative on amazon that has clean ingredients and the same style pump. plus its refillable. That's the only reason its 4 stars for me.

reviews.review_text: I very much wanted to love this product and I DO!!!  I have tried many kinds of dry shampoos with varying results -- including a couple of non-aerosol  ones like Bumble and Bumble, and Briorgio.  Nothing horrible about any of them.  Liked them just fine.  But either I didn't get enough umph out of them, they didn't last as long as I'd like, or the delivery system was weak -- the Bumble and Bumble? Please.  I'm supposed to sprinkle that on my scalp?  What do I do for the sides?  It was a neck breaking exercise. They worked, sure, but none of them were the whole package, you know?  Then I got THIS.  You just shake it up and shoot!  Hold it close in if you need a lot, further out if you need a dusting.  You can get your scalp or your length.  You can rub this in completely.  You can go forever on this. I recently had emergency eye surgery which meant I couldn't wash my hair (I could have gone to a salon, I guess) and went 3 weeks with this stuff.  After 3 weeks there was some stiffness in the hair at the scalp, no doubt, but you couldn't see it.  I'm not going to tell you I was shower fresh, but I could have gone out or done a virtual meeting no problem.    For best results shake it and dispense -- you're going to get a pretty good dose that first pump.  I saw somebody saying it just left a big dot on their hair.  Yup.  I can believe it.    I'd recommend doing your main part with that first few pumps -- where you need the most product.  I would also recommend that you give yourself a good rub or brushing after your done the application -- like a final all over thing.    This product is amazing.  I have received nothing to write this review.

reviews.review_text: When I say this has changed my life... I mean it!!!  I have fine, thin, very oily hair and typically have to wash it every day (2 days if i'm lucky)! Like on the third day, it will literally look wet.  I have tried training my hair, PH balancing shampoos...countless dry shampoos (Batiste, Kevin Murphy, Oribe, Amika, IGK,  Drybar, bumble&bumble, Dove, Colab, Klorane, verb, sephora brand etc...)  Dae Fairy Duster has taken the top spot for me. This is the ONLY dry shampoo that makes my hair LOOK as if it was freshly washed days later.   A couple things to note...   1. it took a minute to get used to the application but i am obsessed with this powder formula! A little goes a long way. Honestly you don't need the dae blending brush either - fingers work just fine! But make sure you let it sit for a minute before rubbing it in.   2. It also makes my hair/scalp feel a bit... starchy? but this does not affect the movement of your hair. Though it feels starchy, it does not feel heavy, crunchy, or dirty! I prefer this over aerosol shampoos.   3. For best performance, it's been really working for me to apply the dry shampoo immediately after I wash/blow dry my hair. My hair still looks and feels freshly washed the next morning.   also it smells SOOOOOOO lovely (Sweet and citrusy)!    PSA: If you're still on the aerosol bandwagon, here are my top rated dry shampoos for effective oil reduction + doesn't make your hair feel gross!   1. Morccanoil dry shampoo 2. Living Proof Perfect Hair Day

reviews.review_text: * I bought this product with my own money and have no affiliation to this company or product *  Here are the pros: this dry shampoo does as advertised. I applied this to very greasy, unwashed hair going on day number 3 of no washing - usually I wash every other day. The powders quickly absorbed the oil and made my hair look clean again. I also loved the smell of the product; it's light, clean, almost citrus-y in nature. I love almost all of the Dae products' smells.  Now for the cons: I can appreciate the idea of a non-aerosolized dry shampoo, but because of this, the application was very difficult to control. I ended up spending quite a bit of time being meticulous in dispensing this, as a small bottle is $30, but there was still a bit of fall out that felt wasteful. However, I could over look the component of the product if it weren't for the texture. This dry shampoo made my hair incredibly gritty and rough feeling, it feels almost as if I had applied my Bumble and Bumble texturizing spray. If you are able to tolerate that, then this should not be a problem for you. Another issue - this applied well in the morning when I first sprayed it in my hair, but around lunch time I saw what looked like many small, white flakes throughout my scalp that was a result of the dry shampoo. If you are someone with a lighter hair color, I do not think this will be a problem as it is more easily camouflaged, but for my black hair, it was unfortunately very noticeable.   Overall, this works in getting rid of oily hair, but not without its faults. It is not something I would reach for, but there are people who could tolerate the texture and the residue and I think this would work for them. Also, smells amazing.

Definitely feel like the packaging needs to be improved, especially considering the cost! Overall this was a great dry shampoo and I'd recommend.

reviews.review_text: It's a shame this is a pretty good product ruined by bad packaging. I think this is a good dry shampoo and I always prefer a loose powder over aerosol. All of this is fine and good except the packaging on this is not great. It seems like it'd be a twist off at first, but it's not -- you have to pull off a cap, which can be difficult and I often accidentally twist off the top trying to get the cap off. It also dispenses too much product at once, which if not done carefully weighs down my hair because too much has been deposited. I just have to be extra careful with this dry shampoo, which I don't have to with some of my other favorites.
